DataElement.preferredName: Patient Chest Positron Emission Tomography Computed Tomography Performed Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of a chest PET/CT scan being performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Chest Positron Emission Tomography Computed Tomography Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the examination of a patient's chest by positron emission tomography (PET; a technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons within living tissue) combined with computed tomography (CT; a method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Chest Positron Emission Tomography Computed Tomography Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: The part of the human body between the neck and the diaphragm or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.:A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the status of a scan that was performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Status; a condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueDomain.origin: RTOG CRF:Radiation Therapy Oncology Group Case Report Form
